intro: Sida bordasiana, commonly known as the slender sida, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Sida bordasiana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
